snippet: The man charged with second-degree murder in the death of Trayvon Martin had his bond revoked after the judge said he misled the court about his finances.
abstract: George Zimmerman, Florida man charged with second-degree murder in the death of Trayvon Martin, turns himself in to authorities in Sanford, Fla, after Judge Kenneth R Lester Jr revokes Zimmerman's bond upon finding that he misled the court about his finances.
lead_paragraph: The man charged with second-degree murder in the death of Trayvon Martin had his bond revoked after the judge said he misled the court about his finances.

headline.main: Obeying Judge’s Order, Zimmerman Turns Himself In and Is Back in a Florida Jail
headline.print_headline: Obeying Judge’s Order, Zimmerman Turns Himself In and Is Back in a Florida Jail
